P056087.project_name: Pension and Financial Market Reform Technical Assistance Credit

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Pension and Financial Market Reform Technical Assistance Project, is to support the Government's plan to create an equitable, and sustainable system of old-age income security. The components will: 1) implement the parametric reform of the Pay-as-you-go (PAYG) system, through verification of the Instituto Nicaraguense de Seguro Social (INSS) database, the establishment of consensus on projections, and through costs' stimulation of reform options. The method for recognizing acquired rights will be determined, and the capacity of the INSS will be strengthened to develop pension-related information systems, and administration. The component will also include the design of legal, regulatory, and institutional framework for a defined contribution of the pension system, and that of targeted public pillars to determine alternative financing, for the conversion of the PAYG to a Defined Contribution (DC) system. A Public awareness campaign will be developed; 2) design, and develop the organizational structure, institutional by-laws, and operating manuals, and procedures towards a personnel training plan; and, 3) identify, and introduce new insurance, and capital markets instruments for a pension fund investment, by implementing a revision framework for private sector participation in new pension aspects. Banking and financial institutions will be strengthened within a legal framework.
